docs.snippet: The most important figure in Uruguay's victory against England on Thursday didn't score any goals or provide any assists.

docs.snippet: Ben Towill, the co-owner of the Fat Radish, is biking across the U.S. talking to people about food. In his third dispatch, he shares stories of kindly Kentuckians, an epic lunch in Illinois and a welcome alternative to factory farming in Missouri.
docs.abstract: Ben Towill, the co-owner of the Fat Radish, is biking across the U.S. talking to people about food. In his third dispatch, he shares stories of kindly Kentuckians, an epic lunch in Illinois and a welcome alternative to factory farming in Missouri.

headline.main: A Ride Across America | Soccer, Bourbon and a Very Special Farm in Missouri

docs.snippet: The World Cup of surprises is turning into a sweet samba party for teams from the Americas.

headline.main: World Cup of Big Surprises Smiles on Americas
headline.print_headline: World Cup of Big Surprises Smiles on Americas

docs.snippet: Another European soccer heavyweight fell to Latin American opposition on Friday as Costa Rica shocked Italy 1-0, putting the four-times champions' qualification in doubt, but France thumped Switzerland 5-2 in an imperious World Cup display.
docs.lead_paragraph: Another European soccer heavyweight fell to Latin American opposition on Friday as Costa Rica shocked Italy 1-0, putting the four-times champions' qualification in doubt, but France thumped Switzerland 5-2 in an imperious World Cup display.

headline.main: Costa Rica Stun Italy, France Crush Switzerland
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Stun Italy, France Crush Switzerland

headline.seo: France or Switzerland Will Advance With a Victory

docs.snippet: Using a high-pressure defensive style, Costa Rica, ranked 34th in the world, stunned Italy and secured a place in the second round of the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Using a high-pressure defensive style, Costa Rica, ranked 34th in the world, stunned Italy and secured a place in the second round of the World Cup.
docs.abstract: Costa Rica upsets Italy, 1-0, in group stage of the World Cup.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Costa Rica Stuns Italy, Securing Place in Second Round

docs.snippet: The two main clubs in Porto Alegre have a reputation for playing the Uruguayan and Argentine way: tough, and without restraint.
docs.lead_paragraph: The two main clubs in Porto Alegre have a reputation for playing the Uruguayan and Argentine way: tough, and without restraint.
docs.abstract: World Cup Postcard; Gremio and archrival Sport Club Internacional, two local soccer clubs in Porto Alegre, highlight how regional soccer styles act as cultural touchstones in Brazil; teams play in an aggressive style that is most commonly associated with Uruguay and Argentina, style that evokes warrior-like culture of region's gaucho heritage.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: In Porto Alegre, a More Dour Soccer Culture
headline.main: Beautiful Game Played With a Gaúcho Flair in Southern Brazil
headline.print_headline: Beautiful Game Played With a Gaúcho Flair in Southern Brazil

docs.snippet: After being unresponsive from a knee to the head, Álvaro Pereira insisted on playing through Uruguay’s game with England, and was allowed to continue, a decision that drew criticism.
docs.lead_paragraph: After being unresponsive from a knee to the head, Álvaro Pereira insisted on playing through Uruguay’s game with England, and was allowed to continue, a decision that drew criticism.
docs.abstract: Decision to allow injured Uruguayan midfielder Alvaro Periera to continue playing in World Cup group match against England draws criticism; Periera insisted on playing after taking knee to head, despite fact that he was temporarily unresponsive following impact; decision plunges sport into new discussions about how to handle head injuries at time when concussions are becoming major concern in other sports.

headline.seo: Uruguayan Player’s Return After Head Injury Stirs Debate
headline.main: ‘Lights Went Out,’ but He Kept Playing
headline.print_headline: Pereira’s Play Stirs Debate Over Injuries

docs.snippet: Brazil faces what should be a relatively simple task to advance past the group stage at its home World Cup — draw or beat a Cameroon team that is playing its last match before flying home.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil faces what should be a relatively simple task to advance past the group stage at its home World Cup — draw or beat a Cameroon team that is playing its last match before flying home.

headline.main: Brazil Wary of Already Eliminated Cameroon
headline.print_headline: Brazil Wary of Already Eliminated Cameroon
